meanings.definition: In a manner relating to presbyters or elders.
meanings.sent1: The church members gathered presbyterially to discuss the upcoming event.
meanings.sent2: The sermon was delivered presbyterially by the elder, emphasizing unity and love.
meanings.sent3: The presbyterially dressed man accidentally wore mismatched socks to the important meeting.
meanings.sent4: The wisdom of the presbyters shone presbyterially through their actions.
meanings.sent5: She moved presbyterially, with the grace and dignity befitting an elder.

meanings.definition: By means of presbyters or elders.
meanings.sent1: The decision was made presbyterially, with the guidance of the elders.
meanings.sent2: The community was united presbyterially under the leadership of the presbyters.
meanings.sent3: He traveled presbyterially through the ancient forest, seeking the wisdom of the elders.
meanings.sent4: The village was built presbyterially, following the traditions passed down by the elders.
meanings.sent5: The message was delivered presbyterially, ensuring the values of the elders were upheld.
